A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: NO SPOILERS but THE LAST JEDI is a legitimately wonderful film\, built upon a 40 year legacy of these movies and their lore. Where Force Awakens was a broad strokes\, gratuitous love letter to the franchise\, Last Jedi feels like both a striking meta-narrative condemning a lot of what has come before\, and the culture surrounding it\, as well as a beautiful story about failure\, and growing past our mistakes. To say that it's my favorite Star Wars film would be bold\, but I don't know that I can say that it isn't. It isn't even close. It's not a perfect movie\, and there's a point where it definitely feels like it drags\, but I enjoyed every minute of it. The whimsical tone makes this movie feel like a larger-than-life anime at points\, but somehow blends perfectly with these characters that are fleshed out way beyond anything I expected.  I love this movie so goddam much\, y'all.
